You can create an MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence constructor.

MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence()1/1

            MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence QuantConnect.Indicators.MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence (
    *string                       name,
    Int32                        fastPeriod,
    Int32                        slowPeriod,
    Int32                        signalPeriod,
    *MovingAverageType           type,
   )

Creates a MACD indicator for the name. The indicator will be automatically updated on the given resolution.

Parameters
*string name (Optional) The custom name of the indicator whose MACD we want.
Int32 fastPeriod The period for the fast moving average.
Int32 slowPeriod The period for the slow moving average.
Int32 signalPeriod The period for the signal moving average.
*MovingAverageType type (Optional) The type of moving average to use for the MACD.

Return

MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence - The moving average convergence divergence between the fast and slow averages

Definition at file Indicators/MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

private MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence _macd;
// In Initialize()
_macd = new MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence(fastPeriod, slowPeriod, signalPeriod);
_macd.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _macd, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_macd.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _macd.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.macd = MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence(fastPeriod, slowPeriod, signalPeriod)
self.macd.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.macd, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.macd.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.macd.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with time/decimal pair. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

With this method, the indicator will only be ready after the Update() method has been used to pump enough data.

private MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence _macd;
private Symbol _symbol;
// In Initialize()
_macd = new MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence(fastPeriod, slowPeriod, signalPeriod);
_symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _macd.Update(data[_symbol].EndTime, data[_symbol].High);
}
if (_macd.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _macd.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.macd = MovingAverageConvergenceDivergence(fastPeriod, slowPeriod, signalPeriod)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.macd.Update(data[self.symbol].EndTime, data[self.symbol].High)
if self.macd.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.macd.Current.Value
